Description: An approximately rhomboidal palette: of white quartzite with pale brown patches, with roughly finished edges and surfaces. There are slight traces of wear in the centre of one side as a result of use.
Cultures/periods: Nubia and Sudan periods and cultures
Curator's comments: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13 and pl. II. For other examples of quartzite palettes from Early Dynastic Nubia, see I. Hofmann, 'Die Kulturen des Niltals', 99-100, with references given there; also H. Åke-Nordstrom, ‘The Scandinavian Joint Expedition to Sudenese Nubia’: vols. 3:1 ‘Neolithic and A-group Sites’ (Stockholm, 1972), 120 and 3:2, pls.54. 191.
